author: Oliver Smith
title: One in four Britons couldn't afford a holiday this year
text: Twenty-three percent of Britons chose not to take an annual holiday this year, up from a fifth in 2014 and 10 per cent in 2011. The findings, published today as part of Abta's annual Holiday Habits Report, shows that British families are facing greater financial pressures, the travel association suggested. British families are facing greater financial pressures, the Abta report suggests Photo: Fotolia/AP Overall, however, Britons took more holidays this year, 3.2 on average, compared with three in 2014, revealing a growing gap between the "holiday haves and have-nots", the report claimed. "The travel industry has seen a steady return to growth in recent years following the credit crunch and worldwide economic crisis," said Mark Tanzer, Abta chief executive. "However, some people are clearly still feeling the pinch, and are either cutting back [or] not taking a holiday at all." The survey of more than 2,000 adults in Britain found that a further 23 per cent opted for just a UK holiday this year, suggesting that almost half of Britain (46 per cent) did not take a foreign break in 2015. Thirteen per cent only took an overseas holiday, while 41 per cent took both domestic and foreign breaks. St Ives, Cornwall Photo: Fiotolia/AP The report's other findings included: London residents took the most holidays in 2015 (4.4 on average), followed by those in the North West (3.5) Those living in Northern Ireland took the least (1.8 on average) Those in Scotland get through the most spending money on an overseas break, with 44 per cent requiring Â£500 or more Those from the South West are the most likely to only take a holiday in Britain Those from Yorkshire are most likely to book a last-minute break City breaks are the most popular type of holiday, accounting for 54 per cent of all holidays booked 10 per cent of holidays booked in 2015 were cruises 40 per cent used a mobile or tablet to book a holiday this year, up from 35 per cent in 2014 The report was presented at the annual Abta Convention at the Costa Navarino resort in the Peloponnese region of Greece. 2011 2012 2013 2014 2015 Average number of holidays taken 3.9 3.5 3.1 3 3.2 Percentage of Britons taking no holiday 10 17 17 20 23 Telegraphtravel
